result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew R Bickford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY WOOD COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.
AODA evaluation and comply as deemed necessary.

Counseling deemed necessary, which may include Thinking for a Change.

Absolute sobriety. Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol. 

DNA sample must be provided within 30 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew R Bickford

records.addlTxt: Order Revoking Huber Privileges for 30 days (with WCSD report)

1:41 PM Defendant Andrew R Bickford appeared by video, in custody. 
Wood County Jail is requesting Huber privileges be revoked due to rule violations. 
Court questions defendant.
Court revokes Huber privileges for 30 days. After 30 days, defendant can pay for UA and if negative, Huber privileges may be reinstated. He can get tested every 15 days.

records.addlTxt:
10:02 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Andrew R Bickford in court. 
Defendant states he is eligible for public defender and they will be appointing counsel.
Matter will be set for arraignment. Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:12 AM Defendant Andrew R Bickford in court.  Jennifer C Zima appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has contacted Public Defender and they are still assessing him. 
Bond is continued.  Arraignment scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:36 AM Defendant Andrew R Bickford in court.  Jennifer C Zima appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions defendant regarding non-representation. He states that he has applied to Public Defender, but his former employer has not provided information to them. Court will proceed with preliminary hearing today.
Brandon Christensen is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Zima. He is a sergeant with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. He assisted Deputy Liebe with a traffic stop on 1/30/22. He stopped the vehicle because of reported drug activity at Ho-Chunk Casino. The driver of the vehicle was identified as the defendant. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. He had his canine perform a free air sniff of the vehicle. The canine indicated on the vehicle. The occupants were recmoved from the vehicle and defendant requested to have his medication. A crystalline substance was found in the pill bottles and it tested positive for methamphetamine.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Bond is continued.  Arraignment scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on February 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
01:48 PM Defendant Andrew R Bickford in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Jennifer C Zima appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
